channel.title: Updating/upgrading as user without being in sudo group?
channel.description:
So the way I installed Kicksecure was without granting root rights to user to lock it down better. How can I make it so user can still do upgrade-nonroot without adding user to the sudo group?
Would changing the permissions to the `upgrade-nonroot` and `apt-get-update-plus` achieve this?
`chmod 755 /usr/bin/upgrade-nonroot`
`chmod 755 /usr/bin/apt-get-update-plus`
Would this be a stupid idea? (just want to be able to use user to update/upgrade not install packages)
